description: Adam Boehler, Trump’s special envoy for hostage affairs, publicly said two things on Sunday morning that aren’t allowed.
title: Twin fictions in American discourse about the Israeli-Palestinian conflict

description: Former House Speaker Nancy Pelosi (D-Calif.) on Friday issued a blistering statement on how senators should handle a government funding vote that, without naming him, dinged Senate Minority Leader Chuck Schumer (D-N.Y.). “Democratic senators should listen to the women,” Pelosi said. “Appropriations leaders Rosa DeLauro [D-Conn.] and Patty Murray [D-Wash.] have eloquently presented the case…
title: Pelosi shades Schumer on funding bill: ‘Listen to the women’

description: Former New Hampshire Gov. Chris Sununu (R) expressed confidence that he would win retiring Sen. Jeanne Shaheen’s (D-N.H.) seat if he decided to run in the 2026 race. “…My biggest fear is that I would win. I’m not too worried about that, actually,” Sununu said in an interview on Fox News’ “The Guy Benson Show” published on…
title: Sununu says he’d win NH Senate race if he runs

description: The United States needs a National Economic Security Strategy to protect and utilize its economic tools and assets in order to maintain geopolitical competitiveness and deter the China's aggression.
title: America needs a national economic security strategy to counter China’s rise

description: It will take more than the president — no matter how serious his commitment — to fully deliver on a promise like this.
title: Is Trump’s ‘Golden Age’ a bridge too far?

description: Sen. Jeff Merkley (D-Ore.) said the current fight over a Republican spending bill was the “best time” for Democrats to take on President Trump, coming less than two months into his presidency. Speaking on CNN Thursday, Merkley said, “The best time to take on a tyrant is as early as possible, and this is the…
title: Senate Democrat: This is ‘best time’ to take on ‘tyrant’ Trump

description: Retired federal judge J. Michael Luttig said Thursday President Trump’s executive order targeting the law firm Perkins Coie is “one of the most sinister” that he “has entered to date.” Speaking on MSNBC, Luttig said Trump had “declared war on the rule of law” even before he returned to the White House. “In the past…
title: Perkins Coie executive order ‘one of the most sinister’ Trump has entered: Luttig

description: Senate Minority Leader Chuck Schumer quickly apologized for calling Republicans "bastards" on live television while criticizing their stopgap funding plan, which he will vote in favor of rather than let the government shut down.
title: Schumer apologizes for calling Republicans ‘bastards’

description: In today’s issue:    Senators are working down to the wire to avoid a midnight funding lapse in Washington that would carry major ramifications.  Despite widespread Democratic criticism of the House’s stopgap bill, a number of Democrats are expected to vote today to pass the legislation. They argue that keeping the lights on in Washington is…
title: Morning Report — Democrats look to sidestep shutdown blame

description: Presented by GE Aerospace — {beacon} Defense &National Security Defense &National Security PRESENTED BY The Big Story  Zero migrants left at Guantánamo after flights back to US The Trump administration’s plans to detain migrants in Guantánamo Bay, Cuba, is on shaky ground after all 40 such individuals held there were sent back to the United…
title: Zero migrants left at Guantánamo after flights back to US
